replies.msg:
Manchester United to battle Liverpool for Italian starlet Nicolo Barella and more transfer rumours

Man Utd could challenge Liverpool in the January transfer window.

05:00, 17 JAN 2018Updated07:16, 17 JAN 2018

Manchester United face competition from Premier League rivals Liverpool in their pursuit of Nicolo Barella, according to a report.

Barella, 20, has been impressive for Serie A side Cagliari this season, netting two goals from central midfielder.

And according to Corriere dello Sport the Reds would face competition from Juventus and Liverpool for his signature.

The Italy U-21 international has recently signed a new contract at Cagliari until June 2022 - and club president Tommaso Giulini has told clubs it will cost them roughly £44m if they want to sign the youngster.

"I've read everything about his renewal, but we didn't do it to raise his price," Giulini told Rai Radio.

"Nicolo deserved a better salary and an extra year on his contract. We want to grow, improve and do everything to keep Nicolo another season.

"Of course, if there were offers that we couldn't refuse, upwards of €50m, then we could discuss it.

"We'd take the €50m and strengthen the team."

In other news, United have been handed a potential setback in their reported pursuit of Schalke midfielder Leon Goretzka.

The Reds are one of a number of sides rumoured to be interested in signing the German international - who sees his current deal expire at the end of the season.

However Schalke's sporting director Christian Heidel is confident the 22-year-old won't be leaving in the January transfer window.

"There's nothing new to report," Heidel is quoted by ESPN.

"All of the club is fighting to keep him here."
